task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for professional profile and career history of Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_1.data: Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. Originally from Iran, he moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D. After completing his doctoral studies, he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery as a research scientist. In 2021, he transitioned to CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on developing treatments for epilepsy. Following the closure of CODA in 2022 due to funding challenges, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. In 2024, he moved to Amazon Rufus to work on their latest Generative AI product. Throughout his career, Dr. Khaledi Nasab has been involved in various research projects, including studies on the dynamics of excitable tree networks and the development of stimulation methods for neurological disorders. He has also contributed to the Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health, which received the 2024 PROSE Award for "significant contributions" in Clinical Medicine. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_3.query_used: Search academic databases for publications or academic credentials under the name Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_3.data:
Dr. Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist with a diverse academic and professional background. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University, where he conducted research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, focusing on sensory neurons with myelinated dendrites. His doctoral thesis, titled "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks," explored the collective behavior of these neurons, which are relevant to sensory systems such as muscle spindles and electroreceptors. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

During his doctoral studies, Dr. Khaledi Nasab received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award, enabling him to present his research at the annual APS meeting in Boston. His presentation, "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons," highlighted his work on understanding the dynamical principles of information processing in sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

After completing his Ph.D., Dr. Khaledi Nasab joined the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine as a research scientist. He later transitioned to industry, working at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on developing treatments for epilepsy. Following the closure of CODA due to funding challenges, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his industry roles, Dr. Khaledi Nasab has contributed to academic literature. Notably, he co-authored a paper titled "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2022. This study utilized an opinion dynamics model to explore mechanisms for bridging echo chambers in social networks, aiming to promote neutral consensus. ([research-explorer.ista.ac.at](https://research-explorer.ista.ac.at/record/12225?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi Nasab's work spans physics, neuroscience, and artificial intelligence, reflecting his interdisciplinary expertise and commitment to advancing scientific understanding and technological innovation.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_4.query_used: Review Iranian court/legal records databases for any legal proceedings or records
task_4.data:
I searched for legal proceedings or records related to "Ali Khaledi Nasab" in Iranian court databases but found no specific information. However, I did find an article titled "Standing up to fear" authored by Ali Khaledi-Nasab, a doctoral candidate in physics and astronomy at Ohio University. In this article, published in *Science* magazine in April 2017, he discusses the challenges faced by international students, particularly those from Iran, in the United States following the implementation of the first travel ban by the Trump administration. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, there is a mention of an individual named "Ali Khaledi" in the HRANA News Agency archives. However, the available information does not provide further details about this person. ([en-hrana.org](https://www.en-hrana.org/tag/ali-khaledi/?utm_source=openai))

Based on the available sources, there is no evidence of legal proceedings or court records involving an individual named "Ali Khaledi Nasab" in Iran.

citations.title: (PDF) Standing up to fear | Ali Khaledi Nasab - Academia.edu

task_6.query_used: Search Iranian professional directories and professional association memberships
task_6.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist who has been involved in various academic and professional activities. In 2019, he received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the annual APS meeting in Boston, where he presented his research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks in sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, in October 2017, Khaledi Nasab delivered a colloquium talk titled "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" at the Department of Physics at the College of Wooster. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his professional affiliations, there is no publicly available information indicating his membership in Iranian professional directories or associations.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Khaledi Nasab Gives Colloquium Talk at College of Wooster - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_7.query_used: Check online business registration databases for potential entrepreneurial activities
task_7.data: Based on the available information, there is no evidence to suggest that Ali Khaledi Nasab is involved in any entrepreneurial activities or holds business registrations. His professional background is primarily academic and research-focused. He has held positions as a Senior Researcher at Amazon in Seattle, United States, and as a Researcher at the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States. ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio?utm_source=openai)) Additionally, he has published articles on platforms like Medium, discussing topics such as job interviews and career development. ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/?utm_source=openai)) Furthermore, his academic contributions are documented on Google Scholar, where he has authored multiple research papers. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai)) There is no publicly available information indicating his involvement in any business ventures or entrepreneurial activities.

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist, originally from Iran, currently working at Amazon Rufus. He has a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University and previously worked as a research scientist at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery. There is no indication of significant legal or financial risks associated with him based on the available information.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
- Currently works as a physicist and AI scientist at Amazon Rufus.
- Previously worked as a research scientist at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery.
- Earned a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University.
- Gave a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster (2017).

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**
- No specific financial or corporate ties were identified in the provided sources beyond his employment at Amazon Rufus and previous academic positions.

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**
- No legal proceedings or records related to Ali Khaledi Nasab were found in Iranian court databases.

**4. Academic / Public Presence**
- Holds a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University.
- Research focused on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, specifically sensory neurons with myelinated dendrites.
- Received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award to attend the APS meeting in Boston.
- Authored an article titled "Standing up to fear."

**5. Online / Social Media**
- Has a personal website: alikhaledi.com.
- Article "Standing up to fear" published on Academia.edu.
- Tagged in articles on en-hrana.org.

**6. Additional Observations**
- Originally from Iran, moved to the United States in 2014.

### Risk Score
Based on the available information, Ali Khaledi Nasab presents a **Low** reputational risk profile. His background is primarily academic and professional, with no identified legal or financial red flags.

flagged_issues: Report omits CODA Biotherapeutics employment mentioned in retrieval evidence
Missing co-authored paper 'Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge' from 2022
Report states 'no specific financial or corporate ties' but evidence shows multiple corporate employments
Social media search results appear corrupted/repetitive and should be excluded
Missing mention of contributions to Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health (2024 PROSE Award)
Missing affiliations with Ronin Institute and Medium publications
judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian-born physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He holds a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University and has an extensive academic and professional background spanning physics, neuroscience, and artificial intelligence. Based on available evidence, there are no identified legal, financial, or reputational risks associated with him.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
- **Current Position:** Physicist and AI scientist at Amazon Rufus (2024-present)¹
- **Previous Positions:**
  - Research Scientist, AWS Network Capacity Team, Amazon (2022-2024)¹
  - Research Scientist, CODA Biotherapeutics (2021-2022) - gene therapy startup focused on epilepsy treatments¹
  - Research Scientist, Department of Neurosurgery, Stanford University School of Medicine³
  - Senior Researcher, Amazon (Seattle)⁷
  - Researcher, Ronin Institute (Essex County, United States)⁷

**2. Academic Background & Achievements**
- **Ph.D. in Physics**, Ohio University - Dissertation: "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks"³
- **Research Focus:** Dynamics of excitable tree networks, sensory neurons with myelinated dendrites³
- **Awards:** American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award³⁶
- **Presentations:**
  - "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons" - APS Annual Meeting, Boston (2019)³
  - "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" - College of Wooster colloquium (October 2017)⁶

**3. Publications & Contributions**
- Co-authored "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge" in *Scientific Reports* (2022)³
- Article "Standing up to fear" in *Science* magazine (April 2017) - discussing challenges faced by Iranian international students following the Trump administration travel ban⁴
- Contributor to Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health (received 2024 PROSE Award for "significant contributions" in Clinical Medicine)¹
- Active on Medium platform with articles on job interviews and career development⁷
- Google Scholar profile with multiple research papers⁷

**4. Legal / Regulatory Status**
- No legal proceedings or court records found in Iranian databases⁴
- No regulatory issues identified

**5. Online Presence**
- Personal website: alikhaledi.com¹³⁸
- Academia.edu profile⁴
- Google Scholar profile⁷
- Medium blog (ali-khaledi1989.medium.com)⁷
- Tagged in articles on en-hrana.org (context unclear)⁴

**6. Additional Context**
- Immigrated from Iran to the United States in 2014¹
- CODA Biotherapeutics closed in 2022 due to funding challenges¹

### Risk Assessment
Based on comprehensive analysis, Ali Khaledi Nasab presents a **Low Risk** profile:
- Strong academic credentials and professional track record
- No legal or financial red flags identified
- Transparent online presence focused on scientific and professional content
- Career progression shows consistent advancement in reputable organizations

### Data Limitations
- No direct social media profiles (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram) were identified⁵
- Limited information about Iranian professional associations or alumni networks
- No business registrations or entrepreneurial activities found⁷

---
**Footnotes:**
¹ Source: alikhaledi.com (Retrieved 2025-06-13)
³ Source: Academic databases and ohio-forum.com (Retrieved 2025-06-13)
⁴ Source: Iranian court records search and academia.edu (Retrieved 2025-06-13)
⁵ Source: Social media platform searches (Retrieved 2025-06-13)
⁶ Source: ohio-forum.com (Retrieved 2025-06-13)
⁷ Source: Business registration databases, loop.frontiersin.org, scholar.google.com (Retrieved 2025-06-13)
⁸ Source: Iranian university alumni networks search (Retrieved 2025-06-13)

task_6.query_used: Search Iranian professional directories and professional association memberships
task_6.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist who has been involved in various academic and professional activities. In 2019, he received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the annual APS meeting in Boston, where he presented his research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks in sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, in October 2017, Khaledi Nasab delivered a colloquium talk titled "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" at the Department of Physics at the College of Wooster. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his professional affiliations, there is no publicly available information indicating his membership in Iranian professional directories or associations.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Khaledi Nasab Gives Colloquium Talk at College of Wooster - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_7.query_used: Check online business registration databases for potential entrepreneurial activities
task_7.data: Based on the available information, there is no evidence to suggest that Ali Khaledi Nasab is involved in any entrepreneurial activities or holds business registrations. His professional background is primarily academic and research-focused. He has held positions as a Senior Researcher at Amazon in Seattle, United States, and as a Researcher at the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States. ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio?utm_source=openai)) Additionally, he has published articles on platforms like Medium, discussing topics such as job interviews and career development. ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/?utm_source=openai)) Furthermore, his academic contributions are documented on Google Scholar, where he has authored multiple research papers. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai)) There is no publicly available information indicating his involvement in any business ventures or entrepreneurial activities.

task_8.query_used: Explore Iranian university alumni networks and educational background references
task_8.data: Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian physicist and AI scientist who pursued his Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy at Ohio University, where he conducted research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, relevant to certain sensory neurons. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai)) During his doctoral studies, he received the American Physical Society's 2019 Student Travel Award to present his work at the annual APS meeting in Boston. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai)) After completing his Ph.D., he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery as a research scientist, focusing on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai)) In 2022, he transitioned to Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity planning organization. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
